string_table.name: npnxnanbnsnfns00000001101
string_table.string: Use the w, a, s, and d keys to move around the 360 degree image. Press the tab key to jump to interactive markers and hotspots.

slidetranscripts.slidetranscript:
<Document xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <Content> <Block> <Style /> <Span Text="Welcome to the home distillery! You can navigate to the individual chapters by clicking on the buildings.
" /> </Block> <Block> <Style /> <Span Text="However, we recommend you start by learning about the chemistry of distilling before heading out to the other sections.
" /> </Block> <Block> <Style /> </Block> </Content> </Document>

<Document xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <Content> <Block> <Style FlowDirection="LeftToRight" LeadingMargin="72" TrailingMargin="0" FirstLineMargin="72" Justification="Left" ListLevel="2" LineSpacingRule="Multiple" LineSpacing="21" SpacingBefore="0" SpacingAfter="8"> <ListStyle ListType="None" ListTypeFormat="Parentheses" Color="#000000" BulletFont="Arial" /> </Style> <Span Text="The Pomace is the key raw material and the most important element in the whole distillation process. You have to be sure that the fruit of choice whether it be plum, pear, apple or grape has enough sugar to ensure a high alcohol turnover. For grape based pomace, generally, the pomace is the byproduct of grape pressing in winemaking. In some cases, depending how dehydrated the grape is after pressing, you may find yourself adding some simple syrup to ensure the mix has enough sugar. How much? About 1kg of sugar for every bucket of pomace. After you heat up the simple syrup you pour it into the barrel and mix the pomace once daily for 4 consecutive days. You leave the barrel for another 10 days and you should be able to smell a fine pungent aroma of fermented grapes. The mix is now ready to be distilled. Before diving into the equipment let’s learn a bit about the chemistry that goes behind the making of spirits. " /> </Block> </Content> </Document>

<Document xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <Content> <Block> <Style FlowDirection="LeftToRight" LeadingMargin="72" TrailingMargin="0" FirstLineMargin="72" Justification="Left" ListLevel="2" LineSpacingRule="Multiple" LineSpacing="21" SpacingBefore="0" SpacingAfter="8"> <ListStyle ListType="None" ListTypeFormat="Parentheses" Color="#000000" BulletFont="Arial" /> </Style> <Span Text="When it comes to the legal aspect every country has its own legal requirements for making homemade distilled products. In most states, it is actually illegal so it is necessary you consult your local laws if any production of any beverage is produced for non-commercial purposes. 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Style FlowDirection="LeftToRight" LeadingMargin="72" TrailingMargin="0" FirstLineMargin="72" Justification="Left" ListLevel="2" LineSpacingRule="Multiple" LineSpacing="21" SpacingBefore="0" SpacingAfter="8"> <ListStyle ListType="None" ListTypeFormat="Parentheses" Color="#000000" BulletFont="Arial" /> </Style> <Span Text="In the case of Romania, as of 2022, there are laws that dictate the process and limits for homemade spirits. Here are some of the key points:
" /> </Block> <Block> <Style FlowDirection="LeftToRight" LeadingMargin="72" TrailingMargin="0" FirstLineMargin="72" Justification="Left" ListLevel="2" LineSpacingRule="Multiple" LineSpacing="21" SpacingBefore="0" SpacingAfter="8"> <ListStyle ListType="None" ListTypeFormat="Parentheses" Color="#000000" BulletFont="Arial" /> </Style> <Span Text="1. You can only produce alcoholic drinks from fruits grown on your property and not bought at a market. 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Style FlowDirection="LeftToRight" LeadingMargin="72" TrailingMargin="0" FirstLineMargin="72" Justification="Left" ListLevel="2" LineSpacingRule="Multiple" LineSpacing="21" SpacingBefore="0" SpacingAfter="8"> <ListStyle ListType="None" ListTypeFormat="Parentheses" Color="#000000" BulletFont="Arial" /> </Style> <Span Text="2. You must use authorized distillery equipment (such as an alembic) to distill and the equipment must be registered with the authorities.
" /> </Block> <Block> <Style FlowDirection="LeftToRight" LeadingMargin="72" TrailingMargin="0" FirstLineMargin="72" Justification="Left" ListLevel="2" LineSpacingRule="Multiple" LineSpacing="21" SpacingBefore="0" SpacingAfter="8"> <ListStyle ListType="None" ListTypeFormat="Parentheses" Color="#000000" BulletFont="Arial" /> </Style> <Span Text="3. You cannot produce more than 50 liters of fruit-based alcohol regardless of its proof without having to pay excise duties on the extra quantity produced. 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Style FlowDirection="LeftToRight" LeadingMargin="72" TrailingMargin="0" FirstLineMargin="72" Justification="Left" ListLevel="2" LineSpacingRule="Multiple" LineSpacing="21" SpacingBefore="0" SpacingAfter="8"> <ListStyle ListType="None" ListTypeFormat="Parentheses" Color="#000000" BulletFont="Arial" /> </Style> <Span Text="4. Failure to abide by these laws can lead you to be subject to penal trial and sentenced to 1 to 5 years in prison. 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Style FlowDirection="LeftToRight" LeadingMargin="72" TrailingMargin="0" FirstLineMargin="72" Justification="Left" ListLevel="2" LineSpacingRule="Multiple" LineSpacing="21" SpacingBefore="0" SpacingAfter="8"> <ListStyle ListType="None" ListTypeFormat="Parentheses" Color="#000000" BulletFont="Arial" /> </Style> </Block> </Content> </Document>

<Document xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <Content> <Block> <Style FlowDirection="LeftToRight" LeadingMargin="72" TrailingMargin="0" FirstLineMargin="72" Justification="Left" ListLevel="2" LineSpacingRule="Multiple" LineSpacing="21" SpacingBefore="0" SpacingAfter="8"> <ListStyle ListType="None" ListTypeFormat="Parentheses" Color="#000000" BulletFont="Arial" /> </Style> <Span Text="As mentioned in the Legal Requirements section you will most likely have to use an authorized alembic to perform distillation. An alembic can come in many shapes and sizes but there are a few elements that must be present to ensure an efficient and safe distillation. 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Style FlowDirection="LeftToRight" LeadingMargin="108" TrailingMargin="0" FirstLineMargin="72" Justification="Left" ListLevel="2" LineSpacingRule="Multiple" LineSpacing="21" SpacingBefore="0" SpacingAfter="8"> <ListStyle ListType="None" ListTypeFormat="Parentheses" Color="#000000" BulletFont="Arial" /> </Style> <Span Text="1)	A boiler (pressure cooker) where the pomace goes with pressure valves made generally out of stainless steel. 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Style FlowDirection="LeftToRight" LeadingMargin="108" TrailingMargin="0" FirstLineMargin="72" Justification="Left" ListLevel="2" LineSpacingRule="Multiple" LineSpacing="21" SpacingBefore="0" SpacingAfter="8"> <ListStyle ListType="None" ListTypeFormat="Parentheses" Color="#000000" BulletFont="Arial" /> </Style> <Span Text="2)	Swans neck - made out of copper that guides the vapors into the coil inside the condenser where the cooling happens. 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Style FlowDirection="LeftToRight" LeadingMargin="108" TrailingMargin="0" FirstLineMargin="72" Justification="Left" ListLevel="2" LineSpacingRule="Multiple" LineSpacing="21" SpacingBefore="0" SpacingAfter="8"> <ListStyle ListType="None" ListTypeFormat="Parentheses" Color="#000000" BulletFont="Arial" /> </Style> <Span Text="3)	The condenser - also made out of stainless steel, its purpose is to allow for condensation in the coil to occur and for alcohol to come out
" /> </Block> <Block> <Style FlowDirection="LeftToRight" LeadingMargin="36" TrailingMargin="0" FirstLineMargin="36" Justification="Left" ListLevel="1" LineSpacingRule="Multiple" LineSpacing="21" SpacingBefore="0" SpacingAfter="8"> <ListStyle ListType="None" ListTypeFormat="Parentheses" Color="#000000" BulletFont="Arial" /> </Style> <Span Text="Additionally, you have three valves. One for allowing the overflow of water when topping up with cold water to maintain a low temperature for condensation. Another valve for emptying the condenser once you are done with the distillation process. 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Style FlowDirection="LeftToRight" LeadingMargin="36" TrailingMargin="0" FirstLineMargin="36" Justification="Left" ListLevel="1" LineSpacingRule="Multiple" LineSpacing="21" SpacingBefore="0" SpacingAfter="8"> <ListStyle ListType="None" ListTypeFormat="Parentheses" Color="#000000" BulletFont="Arial" /> </Style> <Span Text="The open valve at the very bottom of the coil is where the alcohol collection takes place. 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Style FlowDirection="LeftToRight" LeadingMargin="36" TrailingMargin="0" FirstLineMargin="36" Justification="Left" ListLevel="1" LineSpacingRule="Multiple" LineSpacing="21" SpacingBefore="0" SpacingAfter="8"> <ListStyle ListType="None" ListTypeFormat="Parentheses" Color="#000000" BulletFont="Arial" /> </Style> <Span Text="The reason the main components, and in more expensive alembics all of the components, are made of copper is that this type of metal is very malleable and easy to mold into organic shapes such as coils. It prevents corrosion and is an excellent conductor (easy to cool). It is also said that the distillate tastes much better when ran through copper than other metals and chemical reactions with sulfur and fatty acids give the fruit brandy a unique taste. Click on each of the numbers to see again each of the components. " /> </Block> </Content> </Document>

<Document xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <Content> <Block> <Style FlowDirection="LeftToRight" LeadingMargin="36" TrailingMargin="0" FirstLineMargin="36" Justification="Left" ListLevel="1" LineSpacingRule="Multiple" LineSpacing="21" SpacingBefore="0" SpacingAfter="8"> <ListStyle ListType="None" ListTypeFormat="Parentheses" Color="#000000" BulletFont="Arial" /> </Style> <Span Text="To begin distillation, let's first assemble the equipment and get it ready.
" /> </Block> <Block> <Style FlowDirection="LeftToRight" LeadingMargin="36" TrailingMargin="0" FirstLineMargin="36" Justification="Left" ListLevel="1" LineSpacingRule="Multiple" LineSpacing="21" SpacingBefore="0" SpacingAfter="8"> <ListStyle ListType="None" ListTypeFormat="Parentheses" Color="#000000" BulletFont="Arial" /> </Style> <Span Text=" Drag and drop the components in the right place, then click Submit.
" /> </Block> <Block> <Style FlowDirection="LeftToRight" LeadingMargin="36" TrailingMargin="0" FirstLineMargin="36" Justification="Left" ListLevel="1" LineSpacingRule="Multiple" LineSpacing="21" SpacingBefore="0" SpacingAfter="8"> <ListStyle ListType="None" ListTypeFormat="Parentheses" Color="#000000" BulletFont="Arial" /> </Style> </Block> </Content> </Document>

<Document xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <Content> <Block> <Style FlowDirection="LeftToRight" LeadingMargin="36" TrailingMargin="0" FirstLineMargin="36" Justification="Left" ListLevel="1" LineSpacingRule="Multiple" LineSpacing="21" SpacingBefore="0" SpacingAfter="8"> <ListStyle ListType="None" ListTypeFormat="Parentheses" Color="#000000" BulletFont="Arial" /> </Style> <Span Text="That's perfect, now that it is assembled fill the boiler with pomace and place the alcohol collection tray next to the condenser valve.
" /> </Block> <Block> <Style FlowDirection="LeftToRight" LeadingMargin="36" TrailingMargin="0" FirstLineMargin="36" Justification="Left" ListLevel="1" LineSpacingRule="Multiple" LineSpacing="21" SpacingBefore="0" SpacingAfter="8"> <ListStyle ListType="None" ListTypeFormat="Parentheses" Color="#000000" BulletFont="Arial" /> </Style> <Span Text=" Drag and drop the items in the right place to complete the task then click on the burner to start distilling.
" /> </Block> <Block> <Style FlowDirection="LeftToRight" LeadingMargin="36" TrailingMargin="0" FirstLineMargin="36" Justification="Left" ListLevel="1" LineSpacingRule="Multiple" LineSpacing="21" SpacingBefore="0" SpacingAfter="8"> <ListStyle ListType="None" ListTypeFormat="Parentheses" Color="#000000" BulletFont="Arial" /> </Style> </Block> </Content> </Document>

<Document xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <Content> <Block> <Style FlowDirection="LeftToRight" LeadingMargin="36" TrailingMargin="0" FirstLineMargin="36" Justification="Left" ListLevel="1" LineSpacingRule="Multiple" LineSpacing="21" SpacingBefore="0" SpacingAfter="8"> <ListStyle ListType="None" ListTypeFormat="Parentheses" Color="#000000" BulletFont="Arial" /> </Style> <Span Text=" Lastly, let's not forget to fill the condenser up with cold water to ensure condensation can happen.You will keep adding cold water everytime you feel the water getting warm. You can dip your hand inside to test it out. 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Style FlowDirection="LeftToRight" LeadingMargin="36" TrailingMargin="0" FirstLineMargin="36" Justification="Left" ListLevel="1" LineSpacingRule="Multiple" LineSpacing="21" SpacingBefore="0" SpacingAfter="8"> <ListStyle ListType="None" ListTypeFormat="Parentheses" Color="#000000" BulletFont="Arial" /> </Style> <Span Text="Don't worry. It won't get hot enough to burn you if you keep replenishing it in time. 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Style FlowDirection="LeftToRight" LeadingMargin="36" TrailingMargin="0" FirstLineMargin="36" Justification="Left" ListLevel="1" LineSpacingRule="Multiple" LineSpacing="21" SpacingBefore="0" SpacingAfter="8"> <ListStyle ListType="None" ListTypeFormat="Parentheses" Color="#000000" BulletFont="Arial" /> </Style> <Span Text="Drag and drop the cold water pitcher to the condenser then click Submit.
" /> </Block> <Block> <Style FlowDirection="LeftToRight" LeadingMargin="36" TrailingMargin="0" FirstLineMargin="36" Justification="Left" ListLevel="1" LineSpacingRule="Multiple" LineSpacing="21" SpacingBefore="0" SpacingAfter="8"> <ListStyle ListType="None" ListTypeFormat="Parentheses" Color="#000000" BulletFont="Arial" /> </Style> </Block> </Content> </Document>

<Document xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <Content> <Block> <Style FlowDirection="LeftToRight" LeadingMargin="36" TrailingMargin="0" FirstLineMargin="36" Justification="Left" ListLevel="1" LineSpacingRule="Multiple" LineSpacing="21" SpacingBefore="0" SpacingAfter="8"> <ListStyle ListType="None" ListTypeFormat="Parentheses" Color="#000000" BulletFont="Arial" /> </Style> <Span Text="While we wait for the hot vapors to go through the coil let’s talk about what parts of the distillate you keep and which you throw away. After the distillation begins the percentage of alcohol will steadily decrease with every cup collected.
" /> </Block> <Block> <Style FlowDirection="LeftToRight" LeadingMargin="36" TrailingMargin="0" FirstLineMargin="36" Justification="Left" ListLevel="1" LineSpacingRule="Multiple" LineSpacing="21" SpacingBefore="0" SpacingAfter="8"> <ListStyle ListType="None" ListTypeFormat="Parentheses" Color="#000000" BulletFont="Arial" /> </Style> <Span Text="Depending on where you are in the process some parts are to be collected for the final mix while some, because of health hazards, will be thrown away.
" /> </Block> <Block> <Style FlowDirection="LeftToRight" LeadingMargin="36" TrailingMargin="0" FirstLineMargin="36" Justification="Left" ListLevel="1" LineSpacingRule="Multiple" LineSpacing="21" SpacingBefore="0" SpacingAfter="8"> <ListStyle ListType="None" ListTypeFormat="Parentheses" Color="#000000" BulletFont="Arial" /> </Style> <Span Text="Click on each section to find out more.
" /> </Block> <Block> <Style FlowDirection="LeftToRight" LeadingMargin="36" TrailingMargin="0" FirstLineMargin="36" Justification="Left" ListLevel="1" LineSpacingRule="Multiple" LineSpacing="21" SpacingBefore="0" SpacingAfter="8"> <ListStyle ListType="None" ListTypeFormat="Parentheses" Color="#000000" BulletFont="Arial" /> </Style> <Span Text="The first liquid to come out of the coil is called the foreshot and it will most likely smell like nailpolish remover and contain a very high amount of methanol. 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Style FlowDirection="LeftToRight" LeadingMargin="36" TrailingMargin="0" FirstLineMargin="36" Justification="Left" ListLevel="1" LineSpacingRule="Multiple" LineSpacing="21" SpacingBefore="0" SpacingAfter="8"> <ListStyle ListType="None" ListTypeFormat="Parentheses" Color="#000000" BulletFont="Arial" /> </Style> <Span Text="Throw this away! It is bad for your health and if consumed can lead to blindness or even death. 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Style FlowDirection="LeftToRight" LeadingMargin="36" TrailingMargin="0" FirstLineMargin="36" Justification="Left" ListLevel="1" LineSpacingRule="Multiple" LineSpacing="21" SpacingBefore="0" SpacingAfter="8"> <ListStyle ListType="None" ListTypeFormat="Parentheses" Color="#000000" BulletFont="Arial" /> </Style> <Span Text="The second part is called the Head. This distillate will smell a lot cleaner and be anywhere around 80% in terms of alcohol concentration. 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Style FlowDirection="LeftToRight" LeadingMargin="36" TrailingMargin="0" FirstLineMargin="36" Justification="Left" ListLevel="1" LineSpacingRule="Multiple" LineSpacing="21" SpacingBefore="0" SpacingAfter="8"> <ListStyle ListType="None" ListTypeFormat="Parentheses" Color="#000000" BulletFont="Arial" /> </Style> <Span Text="You can re-distill this part later or use it to blend and increase the final alcohol concentration. 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Style FlowDirection="LeftToRight" LeadingMargin="36" TrailingMargin="0" FirstLineMargin="36" Justification="Left" ListLevel="1" LineSpacingRule="Multiple" LineSpacing="21" SpacingBefore="0" SpacingAfter="8"> <ListStyle ListType="None" ListTypeFormat="Parentheses" Color="#000000" BulletFont="Arial" /> </Style> <Span Text="The heart is the best part in terms of strength and taste. The sweet spot can be anywhere between 32% and 75%.
" /> </Block> <Block> <Style FlowDirection="LeftToRight" LeadingMargin="36" TrailingMargin="0" FirstLineMargin="36" Justification="Left" ListLevel="1" LineSpacingRule="Multiple" LineSpacing="21" SpacingBefore="0" SpacingAfter="8"> <ListStyle ListType="None" ListTypeFormat="Parentheses" Color="#000000" BulletFont="Arial" /> </Style> <Span Text="This is the core mix of your final blend. You should collect until the alcohol level drops below 32% 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Style FlowDirection="LeftToRight" LeadingMargin="36" TrailingMargin="0" FirstLineMargin="36" Justification="Left" ListLevel="1" LineSpacingRule="Multiple" LineSpacing="21" SpacingBefore="0" SpacingAfter="8"> <ListStyle ListType="None" ListTypeFormat="Parentheses" Color="#000000" BulletFont="Arial" /> </Style> <Span Text="The tail has very little alcohol and can ruin the taste of the final mix if too much is added. Do not collect any of the Tail. 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Style FlowDirection="LeftToRight" LeadingMargin="36" TrailingMargin="0" FirstLineMargin="36" Justification="Left" ListLevel="1" LineSpacingRule="Multiple" LineSpacing="21" SpacingBefore="0" SpacingAfter="8"> <ListStyle ListType="None" ListTypeFormat="Parentheses" Color="#000000" BulletFont="Arial" /> </Style> </Block> </Content> </Document>

<Document xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <Content> <Block> <Style FlowDirection="LeftToRight" LeadingMargin="36" TrailingMargin="0" FirstLineMargin="36" Justification="Left" ListLevel="1" LineSpacingRule="Multiple" LineSpacing="21" SpacingBefore="0" SpacingAfter="8"> <ListStyle ListType="None" ListTypeFormat="Parentheses" Color="#000000" BulletFont="Arial" /> </Style> <Span Text="After every cycle you can store the alcohol produced in glass bottles and mix depending on your target level. For example, if you want something stronger you will collect the Head and include it while stopping the distillation process sooner so it doesn’t go too close to the Tail. 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Style FlowDirection="LeftToRight" LeadingMargin="36" TrailingMargin="0" FirstLineMargin="36" Justification="Left" ListLevel="1" LineSpacingRule="Multiple" LineSpacing="21" SpacingBefore="0" SpacingAfter="8"> <ListStyle ListType="None" ListTypeFormat="Parentheses" Color="#000000" BulletFont="Arial" /> </Style> <Span Text="Reversely, you can not collect the Head and start at the Heart and opt for a lower proof spirit. 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Style FlowDirection="LeftToRight" LeadingMargin="36" TrailingMargin="0" FirstLineMargin="36" Justification="Left" ListLevel="1" LineSpacingRule="Multiple" LineSpacing="21" SpacingBefore="0" SpacingAfter="8"> <ListStyle ListType="None" ListTypeFormat="Parentheses" Color="#000000" BulletFont="Arial" /> </Style> <Span Text="It seems we are getting the first drips of distillate in our setup! Let’s see if you remember what to do. 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Style FlowDirection="LeftToRight" LeadingMargin="36" TrailingMargin="0" FirstLineMargin="36" Justification="Left" ListLevel="1" LineSpacingRule="Multiple" LineSpacing="21" SpacingBefore="0" SpacingAfter="8"> <ListStyle ListType="None" ListTypeFormat="Parentheses" Color="#000000" BulletFont="Arial" /> </Style> <Span Text="Drag and drop the bowl into the alcohol meter glass on the right to measure the alcohol concentration." /> </Block> </Content> </Document>

<Document xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <Content> <Block> <Style FlowDirection="LeftToRight" LeadingMargin="36" TrailingMargin="0" FirstLineMargin="36" Justification="Left" ListLevel="1" LineSpacingRule="Multiple" LineSpacing="21" SpacingBefore="0" SpacingAfter="8"> <ListStyle ListType="None" ListTypeFormat="Parentheses" Color="#000000" BulletFont="Arial" /> </Style> <Span Text=" You did it! After you are done collecting you will have to clean the boiler and get ready to put another scoop of pomace and repeat the process. 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Style FlowDirection="LeftToRight" LeadingMargin="36" TrailingMargin="0" FirstLineMargin="36" Justification="Left" ListLevel="1" LineSpacingRule="Multiple" LineSpacing="21" SpacingBefore="0" SpacingAfter="8"> <ListStyle ListType="None" ListTypeFormat="Parentheses" Color="#000000" BulletFont="Arial" /> </Style> <Span Text="Before we go, let’s talk a bit about storage. 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Style FlowDirection="LeftToRight" LeadingMargin="36" TrailingMargin="0" FirstLineMargin="36" Justification="Left" ListLevel="1" LineSpacingRule="Multiple" LineSpacing="21" SpacingBefore="0" SpacingAfter="8"> <ListStyle ListType="None" ListTypeFormat="Parentheses" Color="#000000" BulletFont="Arial" /> </Style> <Span Text="Freshly distilled alcohol needs to age for at least 6 months before consumption.
" /> </Block> <Block> <Style FlowDirection="LeftToRight" LeadingMargin="36" TrailingMargin="0" FirstLineMargin="36" Justification="Left" ListLevel="1" LineSpacingRule="Multiple" LineSpacing="21" SpacingBefore="0" SpacingAfter="8"> <ListStyle ListType="None" ListTypeFormat="Parentheses" Color="#000000" BulletFont="Arial" /> </Style> <Span Text="This can be done either in glass bottles with the option of adding some mulberry wood to color and give a nice wooden finish to the spirit. 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Style FlowDirection="LeftToRight" LeadingMargin="36" TrailingMargin="0" FirstLineMargin="36" Justification="Left" ListLevel="1" LineSpacingRule="Multiple" LineSpacing="21" SpacingBefore="0" SpacingAfter="8"> <ListStyle ListType="None" ListTypeFormat="Parentheses" Color="#000000" BulletFont="Arial" /> </Style> <Span Text="Or, more professionally, store it into mulberry barrels. It is up to you! Cheers!
" /> </Block> <Block> <Style FlowDirection="LeftToRight" LeadingMargin="36" TrailingMargin="0" FirstLineMargin="36" Justification="Left" ListLevel="1" LineSpacingRule="Multiple" LineSpacing="21" SpacingBefore="0" SpacingAfter="8"> <ListStyle ListType="None" ListTypeFormat="Parentheses" Color="#000000" BulletFont="Arial" /> </Style> </Block> </Content> </Document>

<Document xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <Content> <Block> <Style FlowDirection="LeftToRight" LeadingMargin="72" TrailingMargin="0" FirstLineMargin="72" Justification="Left" ListLevel="2" LineSpacingRule="Multiple" LineSpacing="21" SpacingBefore="0" SpacingAfter="8"> <ListStyle ListType="None" ListTypeFormat="Parentheses" Color="#000000" BulletFont="Arial" /> </Style> <Span Text="By definition distillation is a two-step process. 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Style FlowDirection="LeftToRight" LeadingMargin="108" TrailingMargin="0" FirstLineMargin="72" Justification="Left" ListLevel="2" LineSpacingRule="Multiple" LineSpacing="21" SpacingBefore="0" SpacingAfter="8"> <ListStyle ListType="None" ListTypeFormat="Parentheses" Color="#000000" BulletFont="Arial" /> </Style> <Span Text="1)	The transformation of pomace(raw mashed fruits that have been fermenting for aprox. 2 weeks) from a semi-liquid state to a gas state through boiling. 
" /> </Block> <Block> <Style FlowDirection="LeftToRight" LeadingMargin="108" TrailingMargin="0" FirstLineMargin="72" Justification="Left" ListLevel="2" LineSpacingRule="Multiple" LineSpacing="21" SpacingBefore="0" SpacingAfter="8"> <ListStyle ListType="None" ListTypeFormat="Parentheses" Color="#000000" BulletFont="Arial" /> </Style> <Span Text="2)	The conversion of gas back into liquid state (alcohol).
" /> </Block> <Block> <Style FlowDirection="LeftToRight" LeadingMargin="72" TrailingMargin="0" FirstLineMargin="72" Justification="Left" ListLevel="2" LineSpacingRule="Multiple" LineSpacing="21" SpacingBefore="0" SpacingAfter="8"> <ListStyle ListType="None" ListTypeFormat="Parentheses" Color="#000000" BulletFont="Arial" /> </Style> <Span Text="This will become much clearer when we go through the distillation chapter, however it is important to understand why certain steps are enforced and essential in maintaining this balance throughout the course of production." /> </Block> </Content> </Document>

<Document xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <Content> <Block> <Style FlowDirection="LeftToRight" LeadingMargin="72" TrailingMargin="0" FirstLineMargin="72" Justification="Left" ListLevel="2" LineSpacingRule="Multiple" LineSpacing="21" SpacingBefore="0" SpacingAfter="8"> <ListStyle ListType="None" ListTypeFormat="Parentheses" Color="#000000" BulletFont="Arial" /> </Style> <Span Text="Let's go through a small knowledge check before moving forward. As mentioned before, you are sometimes required to add simple syrup to the pomace if the grapes are too dry. Do you remember how much? Let's say we have 3 buckets of pomace. How many kilograms of sugar should we add? Drag the slider to the right amount, then click submit. " /> </Block> </Content> </Document>
